tokens.resolved_gloss: David, the youngest son of Jesse
tokens.translation: David, the youngest son of Jesse

tokens.resolved_gloss: David, the youngest son of Jesse
tokens.translation: David, the youngest son of Jesse

tokens.resolved_gloss: physically, to throw (a stone, an arrow) at or away; especially to revere or worship (with extended hands); intensively, to bemoan (by wringing the hands)
tokens.translation: physically, to throw (a stone, an arrow) at or away; especially to revere or worship (with extended hands); intensively, to bemoan (by wringing the hands)

tokens.resolved_gloss: physically, to throw (a stone, an arrow) at or away; especially to revere or worship (with extended hands); intensively, to bemoan (by wringing the hands)
tokens.translation: physically, to throw (a stone, an arrow) at or away; especially to revere or worship (with extended hands); intensively, to bemoan (by wringing the hands)

tokens.resolved_gloss: properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
tokens.translation: properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)

tokens.resolved_gloss: properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
tokens.translation: properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)

tokens.resolved_gloss: the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
tokens.translation: the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything

tokens.resolved_gloss: the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything

tokens.resolved_gloss: a front, i.e. part opposite; specifically a counterpart, or mate; usually (adverbial, especially with preposition) over against or before
tokens.translation: a front, i.e. part opposite; specifically a counterpart, or mate; usually (adverbial, especially with preposition) over against or before

tokens.resolved_gloss: gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
tokens.translation: gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

tokens.resolved_gloss: properly, to touch the strings or parts of a musical instrument, i.e. play upon it; to make music, accompanied by the voice; hence to celebrate in song and music
tokens.translation: properly, to touch the strings or parts of a musical instrument, i.e. play upon it; to make music, accompanied by the voice; hence to celebrate in song and music
